answerText: leucine zipper[10] This motif is functionally like a leucine zipper and appears in proteins with a characteristic stretch of positively charged amino acids. This motif with a flexible middle region is found in C-myc and MyoD.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale A | 6 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This motif consists of a pair of alpha helices with its namesake amino acid at every seventh residue. For 10 points each: [10] Name this protein motif whose two hydrophobic surfaces are bound together, allowing its downstream basic region to bind to DNA.
